pr_title: [#1501] Add unit tests for FeedbackRankQuestionDetails and FeedbackTextResponseDetails classes

timeline.message: Add unit tests for Feedback*QuestionDetails classes

timeline.bodyText: This test is not really doing anything right? We already test that a valid value is set in the above test. (same for the other one below)
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: add a test for setting/getting duplicates too + you could also test the the default value is Integer.MIN_VALUE
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone
rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: you can assert is null here instead of forcing an NPE
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: I think your naming of the test function should change here as well?
replies.author: ChooJeremy

timeline.bodyText: I think this can be removed - seems like a duplicate of earlier test
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: I think we can test setAnswer and also the default constructor (that sets answer to empty string)
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: These checks aren't necessary, they make the code more complex (uncertainty in what you're testing) and are already covered by the above equal tests.
timeline.author: ChooJeremy

timeline.bodyText:
To be clearer for what you're testing (the function setAnswer), you should test that the initial value isn't testValue i.e.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    assertEquals(feedbackTextResponseDetails.getAnswerString(),
          
          
            
                    assertNotEquals(feedbackTextResponseDetails.getAnswerString(), SanitizationHelper.sanitizeForRichText(testValue));
timeline.author: ChooJeremy

timeline.bodyText:
This change seems unrelated?
Let's try to avoid changes in files that don't impact your PR.
timeline.author: ChooJeremy

timeline.bodyText:
Sorry if I wasn't clear enough. We do want to test that a change has occured, just not test an Equals and a NotEquals of a boolean in the same state.
Something along the lines of:

Create new object
Test that duplicates are allowed is not true
Set duplicates allowed to true
Test that duplicates are allowed is now true.

We can do the same for max options as well.
timeline.author: ChooJeremy
